Reviews.Title: “This is the worst hotel I have been ever had.”
Reviews.Author: Mehmet B
Reviews.Content: I was in otel for ITB fair. Hotel seems like from 70's. Every where needs to be renovation. No service after 08.00 PM. First night I asked to take one extra pillow, receptionist said that it's not possible because there is no any duty employee except receptionist. All carpets are dirty. All mobels are very old. There is a old style TV but there is no remote control. I didn't understand how german autorities doesn't make an inspection

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharon00
Reviews.Content: Definitely a good choice - the double room was absolutely huge and the bed was really comfortable. The hotel is located close to the underground transport system and the location is perfect for easy access to other parts of this wonderful city. I did not eat breakfast here so I can't comment on the food but the staff were helpful enough (if a little cold) and the hotel amenities were perfect for what we wanted on this sightseeing city break - a clean, spacious rom with a comfortable bed and a hot shower in a suitable location. Will definitely stay here again when I return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: banjoman1948
Reviews.Content: From checkin to checkout this hotel exceeded our expectations. The location was perfest, the room was perfect, the breakfast was perfect, the staff were good. The rate included breakfast and the breakfast had it all: eggs, both scrambled and hard boiled, bacon, fruit, cereal, good coffee etc. The underground train was 100 meters from the door and you can go anywhere in Berlin with it. The Hard Rock was across the street and there were resaurants everywhere. We aren't great shoppers but there were stores everywhere to take your money. We took a hop on hop off tour and found it worthwhile. The checkpoint charlie museum highlited the desperation of that era. For the price we paid 55 euro a nite it was a special 4 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good value central location”
Reviews.Author: KeaneTeam
Reviews.Content: Pleasant stay, spacious warm rooms. decor very dated but priced appropriately. Nice staff, fab breakfast €10 not too bad a price.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny.”
Reviews.Author: tastingU
Reviews.Content: It is not a 4 star hotel. Rooms were old but on the bright side ok sized and clean. Great location and nice staff at the reception with warm and welcomming smiles:-) breakfast so-so. Transport within very easy access. Hard rock cafe on the opposite side of the hotel. For lunch go to KaDeWe department store for their lovely food court:-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location,but definitely not a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tasos A
Reviews.Content: We've been there for six days and the location and everything was ok in my room; however, this was not the case with the other party's room, where hymidity was holding a party! Seemed like a former communist house turned into a youth hostel and not a 4 star hotel. There are two underground stations nearby, within walking distance, which is truly helpful but consider staying in another hotel if a renovation doesn't take place immediately! The banquet breakfast was fantastic and tasty (besides the tomatoes) and the personnel were helpful, friendly and smiling and gave you a sense of safety - a big plus - they even allowed us an earlier check in a later check out - which was greatly appreciated. They even kept an eye on our luggages on our departure day which was of a great help. Furthermore, they handed free copies of Berlin maps and overall they were quite polite. I mean everybody. The building, on the other hand, is quite old, with a steady smell of old carpets and quite a few stains on it as well! I would recommend the hotel for its location - especially if you are planning to be in the city most of the day, or if you travel alone but not suggested if you are planning a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Four Star location&breakfast, two star room standard”
Reviews.Author: K F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a super convenient location with airport bus just outside and excellent bus, U-bahn and S-bahn connections within a minute or two from the hotel. I believe the hotel is undergoing a much needed face-lift, if the standard of our room is anything to go by. Ancient, grotty wardrobe and tired old bathroom. Light years away from a 4-star standard. Other rooms we happened to catch a glance of seemed more modern. No internet connection in the room, only wireless network available in the lobby for 5 Euro a day. Not impressed. The breakfast however was sensational and the staff very friendly and helpful. In short: Great location, excellent breakfast, friendly staff, disappointing room.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: This hotel at very good location, for a good price. You don't even need to walk and there's lots of shops, cafes, restaurants, transport etc. The room was fairly spacious for a solo traveller, well designed, and the bed particularly comfortable. My room was on the front of the hotel and I had a lovely view of the main street. The breakfast was a typical continental breakfast but was of good quality. No air conditioning, very hot rooms. Unable to open windows due to traffic noise. Hotel neded a renovation.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a four star hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: John Y
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location, the staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfasts are very good with lots of choice. The rooms and corridors, however, are shabby and years overdue for refurbishment. It is definitely not 4* standard, if the hotel is not careful it could get done if it continues to claim 4* status.

Reviews.Title: “Looks like communistic hotel from the 80'”
Reviews.Author: Ekorek
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks awaful inside. It looks like a communistic hotel from the 80'. In many places you can notice that it has not been renovated for a long time However the hotel is located in the center of Berlin with easy subway access

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: veedubmelb
Reviews.Content: Four nights here over a party weekend in Berlin. It was a little away from the action (my travel companion had booked it) but close to the U-Bahn and walkable to everything we needed. The breakfast was quite nice but had its irritations too (the urn for hot water was always empty, and indicating the fact to staff didn't seem to help with getting it topped up - I ended up filling it myself from the bottled water on the buffet). No internet access in the rooms - you have to pay for it and to go downstairs to the lobby area. The hotel is tired and in need of a refurb (it has a metal key of the last-century variety - not ideal when you have two people sharing but coming and going independently). The plumbing seemed to clog up and the room had poor ventilation and seeming had heating stuck on (it wasn't that hot in Berlin but the room seemed very warm). I wouldn't have picked this place, and found it more than a little disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “It could've been better”
Reviews.Author: pdc1981
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, I loved the arquitecture and the receptionists were very nice. However, they did not disclose the fact that there was no internet access in the rooms (only in public areas and for a cost of 5 additional euros a day). Also, the room I got was soooo far away in the back, I got two single separated beds and the room had back/low view so I could hear every time someone was going to the parking lot or when the train (S-bahn Zoo) passed (basically every 6 minutes). Besides that, it's pretty well located, surrounded by shops and restaurants and really close access to the U-bahn and S-bahn. Very nice walks. Also, it has great room service and a lovely mini-bar.

Reviews.Title: “it was great”
Reviews.Author: Ruth W
Reviews.Content: the hotel is well located, easy to access for disabled people, clean and comfortable. I found the staff polite friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very good and I've never before seen such a selection of breads. Our room was a good size the windows opened easily and the electrically operated blind was a bonus. We will certainly book again next time we visit Berlin. Special thanks to the young man on late duty on reception for his restaurant recommendation, we had a really good anniversary meal.

Reviews.Title: “A Zoo fit only for animals”
Reviews.Author: Pyrrho
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. The hotel's location is good, which is why we choose to stay here. That was a mistake.The staff were chilly, arrogant and unhelpful; our room was in poor/bad condition (e.g. our heavy bathroom door was right off its hinges and it took a whole day to fix this; the shower drain was blocked; there was no soap; and so on). Moreover, the hotel itself was not clean (e.g. the carpets on main stair were dirty and were not hoovered for the three days we were there); the bar/lounge is poorly run and disorganized; etc. This hotel should be avoided. It is poorly managed and poorly maintained. It is noticeably inferior to similarly priced hotels throughout Europe and our experience here took away from the enjoyment and pleasure of our visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION WOULD STAY HERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: dawndevil
Reviews.Content: Back from a week in Berlin staying at the hotel AM Zoo Berlin, having read all the reviews I sort of knew what to expect, the hotel could do with having air conditioning in the rooms and the rooms are slightly old fashioned but didn't mind this, we had to change rooms from room 506 to 507 as 506 had one of the beds broken (the slats that hold the mattress on half of the were completely broken) surprised the mattress managed to stay up. Breakfast excellent wide variety of cereals, cakes, cooked food delicious. The hotel is on the main shopping street Kurfurstendamm, right opposite the hard rock cafe and if you are making your own way from the airport the X109 goes straight there and stops right opposite. The hotel is just around the corner from the local supermarket ullrich and round the corner from the zoo where the local 200 and 100 buses go around all the main tourist attractions would stay here again and recommend to anyone visiting berlin

Reviews.Title: “Hot and noisy but great location”
Reviews.Author: laurawf
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for six days at the end of June. While the hotel is in a great location, the room is clean and the staff is friendly, I would not stay here again. First, the room is very hot. We could not open our window and the door to the outside would only open about two inches at the top. It was completely unbearable during the day and uncomfortable at best during the night. If the heat wasn't enough, the noise level from the street was high. Hard Rock Cafe is right across the street and we found it didn't get quiet until 2 or 3 in the morning on most nights. Third, the internet only works on the first two floors and it doesn't work consistently. So you may pay the high price for it and it may or may not work.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really really hot”
Reviews.Author: SvenTon
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed nice at first glance, trendy lobby and perfectly located smack dab on Kurfürstendamm, 50 meters from the closes tube stop. Breakfast was pretty good, eggs and bacon every day and some other stuff that was switched around from day to day so you didn't get tired of the food. One thing that was extremely annoying was that the juice glasses were one deciliter in size! This means that you have to go back and forth like 5-6 times to fill up your glass during breakfast. Alternatively just fill up and bring a whole lot of glasses to your table. It was difficult to sleep at the hotel because it was so incredibly hot. I can only imagine how it is in July!!! We slept with the windows as open as possible, but we couldn't open them much due to the blind we had to pull down to keep the light out. So the air was no circulation, completely dead and 900 degrees in the room. Had they installed air condition in the rooms, this would have been a great hotel, but sleeping is the most important this in a hotel and when you can't get a good nights sleep, I can't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, great for shopping & value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt_Roberts69
Reviews.Content: Ideal for a couple of nights leisure break when you are spending your own money, however if you expect a business class hotel re-adjust your expectations. Great centrally located property right opposite The Hard Rock Cafe, great for shopping and a nice local German cuisine restaurant in the road opposite (Gasthaus Krombach). Room was a good size and wrapped around the lift shaft (605)........... Fortunately the lift was not working to the 6th floor so we were not able to hear the lift mechanism....... There is an atrium lounge area but no manned bar, reception staff serve drinks as required..... The traffic and nightlife is very noisy and there is no aircon so with the windows open we had to wear earplugs to sleep........ You will definately need the windows open as the weather gets warmer so pack earplugs or opt for a room that faces away from the road to aid sleep.... Overall a good hotel for the money......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel on Kurfurstandammstrasse”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyAsbestos
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel on KDamm not 5 mins walk fro Zoologische Garten S Bahn / U Bahn. Right in the centre of Berlin's theatreland, with dozens of small restaurants nearby. My Favourites are on SavignyPlatz on KantStrasse which is just behind the hotel. [BREL ( Bistro), Mar y Sol ( Spanish) and San Marino (Italian) and the Risacher Wein restaurant] 5 mins from Zoo 30mins from Brandenburger Tor Right on top of the U2 which will get you to Potsdammer Platz in 10 minutes. The hotel is spotlessly clean with a nice bar for evening drinks etc. The rooms were excellent, clean and well furnished. Breakfast was excellent, typically German but with the Berlin tradition of Kuechen as well, which sweet toothed colleague devoured. I had a room in front of hotel and bearing it was on a main road, was vcery quiet. Satellite TV covers most regions. Walk in rate was about 120 Euros, though I paid only 80 after having a little haggle.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, dated, and WAY TOO HOT”
Reviews.Author: benmychree
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 8 nights at the end of September. We got a special rate including breakfast, but with the mediocre TA reviews, we were a bit apprehensive. As per other comments, the location is really excellent. There are 2 buses which run from Tegel Airport which drop you less than a couple of hundred metres away from the hotel, and it is near U- and S-bahn stations, so getting around is a breeze. We didn’t find Berlin that big, so walking to a lot of places was a viable option generally too. The Ku’damm has tons of high end shopping, and a good supply of bars, restaurants and cafes offering something to suit every budget. There is a bar right across the street from the hotel which we can recommend for drinks and reasonable food. There are also a few fast food joints towards the Zoo Station (5 minutes’ walk), and some convenience stores. There is a large supermarket near Zoo Station called Ullrich. Very convenient, with a massive range of reasonably priced alcohol, but just be careful of the derelicts and drunks that seem to congregate around the entrance all the time – we had no trouble with them, but the smell is not pleasant! Don’t miss out a visit to the KaDeWe department store (about 10-15 minutes’ walk towards the city centre), and you MUST visit the 6th/7th floor food hall where all the delicious food and drinks are, including a range of superb live food stations. Seriously, you have to eat there at least once. Heading the other way, take any of the many buses 6 stops to 100 Ku’damm, the “House of 100 Beers” from all over the world, plus they also do some very tasty and well priced German food. The hotel is pretty old (there is a photo of the hotel dating from 1955, and it is probably even older than that), and in some ways it shows its age. The lobby and mezzanine lounge area give a very modern and trendy feel, but the rest of the hotel is rather tired and dated. The stairway carpets are threadbare in places, and presuming that they are not protected by some government preservation order, the old wooden windows with flaking paint also need to be redone. They still even have actual door keys on large heavy metal fobs that you have to hand to reception every time you go out. I can’t remember staying at a hotel with that system since the last century. On booking we were upgraded to an executive room opening onto the interior courtyard, and it was quite spacious with 2 very big wardrobes. You did feel that you had just stepped into a 1980s time warp though, with the pale wood (actually, laminated MDF) done in a whitewash style. The room had a weird layout, with the bathroom on the left immediately on entry and a wardrobe on the right, and a 1980s glass door at the end of that corridor which led to the main room. The TV is tiny, no more than 12 or 14 inches, and the channel selection is poor – about 10 German channels and 1 English news channel, and no pay per view movies. The wooden floorboards under the carpet creak and squeak unmercifully, so there is no quietly sneaking to the bathroom at night so you don’t wake your partner. The bathroom was fine, even good, but it was an interior bathroom with no natural light. There was decent size bath and the shower was hot with good water pressure, even on the 4th floor, and the towels were good quality, although the toilet tissue certainly wasn’t. The room was clean however, as was the hotel in general. Our main complaint about the hotel is the unbearable temperature, even though the heating was not switched on. Even in autumn with temperatures at 10c and below while we were there, the hotel was like a hothouse. The only way to stay comfortable in the main room was to have the old wooden windows wide open – both sets, as there are exterior and interior windows. Even then, it was still warm, and there can be plenty of noise coming from other rooms or the terrace area below which then just echoes around the courtyard. Having the windows shut was simply not an option. My wife is like a lizard, craving sun and warmth, but even she found it too warm. The interior bathroom was like a sauna – you would literally come out sweating if you spent more than a couple of minutes in there. The hotel must be an absolute nightmare in the summer. Another gripe is the lifts – we thought there was only 1, and it was very slow, so at peak times we just used the stairs. However, we discovered a 2nd lift at the back of the hotel, but it stops at the mezzanine floor which means you have to walk all the way round and down a flight of stairs. For some reason the staff never mentioned it was there, but it is only really relevant if you are at the back of the hotel. The final gripe is wifi is 5 Euros per day but you can only access it in the lobby or mezzanine lounge area. There are some very cheap cybercafés nearby however, and Starbucks 100m up the road is free. Breakfast was fine, with a wide selection of hot and cold food to suit everyone. There is no live station though, so the eggs are either scrambled or hard boiled, and the bacon was very greasy and not good. That aside, everything was great, and the service efficient and with a smile. We found all staff – reception and housekeeping too – efficient and friendly. So, great location, decent room rate and breakfast, very average rooms and hotel facilities generally, and more like a 3 star than a 4 star. The biggest thing they need to do is install some air-conditioning as part of a full refurbishment. If we could get the same reduced rate again we would probably stay there again as Berlin is not a cheap city for hotels, but we would not pay the normal rack rate, and we would certainly not go in the summer unless there was aircon.

Reviews.Title: “it was definitely not a 4 star hotel! only 3”
Reviews.Author: Nadezhda_Nadezhda
Reviews.Content: good location is the only advantage. old hotel, terrible bathroom. unfriendly reception staff ! ask for a nonsmoking room, i got a horribly room smelling of tobacco.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great breakfast, clean room, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Deb105
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel. Breakfast was excellent - plenty of choice each day. Bed linen, towels etc very clean. Location was great - right opposite city-tour bus stop, near trains. We were given a non-smoking room as requested. I had requested a double bed, but we ended up with twin beds. We did ask to change, but was told there was no way we could be changed to a double. Main thing that bothered us was that there was no kettle or coffee making facility in the room. Would have been nice to go back to a cuppa at the end of a busy day sightseeing! Overall though, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would not return here”
Reviews.Author: Dave5800
Reviews.Content: We arrived and all seemed ok however we got to our room that was standard but stank of smoke,and all you could here all day and night where trains as we where at back of hotel.The breakfast was poor,There was no bar,no gym but in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Worn but clean, good breakfast, no internet”
Reviews.Author: Proffnerd
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great location and value, but it is worn. However it's clean and breakfast was good. Biggest drawback was the absence of internet access which nearly ruined my business trip. I had a problem with the bed in my room, and it was fixed very efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but too Hot”
Reviews.Author: Ivettechien
Reviews.Content: Be aware that this hotel does not have air condition , it is too hot to stay there in hot summer , other season is nice because the location and room is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteAndersen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Zoo for three days/nights and were very satisfied with the hotel. The location at Kurfürstendamm is very good, the staff is friendly and the rate was very reasonable and included a great breakfast. We will not hesitate to book a stay at Hotel Zoo the next time we visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Hfs2
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel as a birthday present for my partner - initially thought it was a great deal HOWEVER, the pictures on the internet are very misleading. The room was dingy, small, dirty and outdated. The staff were relatively inpolite and it seemed to be a chore to help us. How this hotel is a 4* baffles me. On a more positve note, the breakfast was ok and the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Folies
Reviews.Content: Having made a reservation, "" on behalf "of my 90 year old father, for 8 nights at the Hotel Zoo Berlin, we found Then We Had to cancel due to sudden ill health Loved. The cancellation was Made Two days prior to arrival and we Fully Expected to Be Asked to pay the first penalty has've Nights accommodation. Very Understandable. Can You Believe THEY No Surprise When Demanded 90% OF THE TOTAL STAY as a sum of E941.38 Their cancellation fee! Interestinly, Two Other hotel WHERE My Father Was due to stay Both Before and After the zoo visit Hotel, Were more realistic. One the first nights accommodation Charged, as in nothing. BEWARE OF THIS HOTEL CANCELLATION FEES ARE ..... THEY Outrageous. Pamela Hall-Johnston for Dennis Brown.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TedNes
Reviews.Content: Easy to deal with staff---great English. Great location, easy to get around. Good sized rooms---clean. Ask for a room that opens onto the central courtyard---quieter, and better ventilation

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, location and customer service”
Reviews.Author: PeterMajella
Reviews.Content: Originally booked from 12-16 April 2010 but thanks to all the flight cancellations due to the volcano in Iceland stayed until until 20th. The hotel is ideally located for getting about and seeing Berlin. It is only a couple of minutes walk from Zoo Station which provides rail links to just about anywhere you may need to go. The is a U Bahn station practically outside the hotel as well as a local bus stop. There is no shortage of good shops and restaurants within walking distance, in fact the more you explore the more you find. On the street opposite there is a first class traditional German bar/restaurant on the left hand side of the street, the first one that you will pass. Breakfast at the hotel is first class and will set you up for the day. We cannot praise the reception staff enough. Given the travel chaos at the time they could not have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: racedk
Reviews.Content: Great semi-luxury hotel. Great helpful staff, great breakfast, and great rooms. Two zinks! ;-) Super location near metro and right on the Kurfürstendamm.

Reviews.Title: “we highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: far0ut
Reviews.Content: Hotel Zoo is undoubtedly a high standard hotel. We were there because of a business conference and we booked the rooms surprisingly for a very attractive price (in Easy Click web site). We felt incredibly pampered as the service was wonderful and facilities were great. There was nothing missing really and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “What an awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMole
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel we have ever stayed in. This hotel is listed as a 4 star, to be honest 1 star would be too generous. I would not reccomend this hotel to anyone, unless you like staying in rooms dating back many decades!

Reviews.Title: “Unique - well not quite!”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: When we saw out room on the fifth floor we decided it must be unique, so strange was the layout. But on our return a quick check with tripadvisor revealed our comments mirrored almost exactly those of Elsiedoubleyou. Our twin room also had beds at opposite corners of the room but ours did not boast a desk but an octagonal table - sufficient for a four to five person dinner party - as a fixture in the middle of the room. This was attached to a a long shelf-like pice of equipment, making it difficult to navigate the room space.. The layout, we decided, was perfect for a university students' room . Despite the arctic conditions outside, the room was boiling hot and stayed that way for the rest of the day - it must have been next to a boiler or some heating apparatus. Fortunately, or unfortunately, we found outselves locked i n the following morning due to a faulty door lock. Our ministrations were observed by a cleaner who managed to let us out. As a result we were moved to a lovely room at the front of the hotel, which were thoroughly enjoyed for the rest of our stay. This is our second visit to this hotel and while I would agree with other guests that does not have the quality or the facilities of a four star establishment it has, for us, three great pluses - situation, great breakfasts and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Three years on... not so good!”
Reviews.Author: eskay07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Zoo three years ago and were very happy with it so booked it again for this trip. Unfortunately we were very disappointed this time around as although the lobby/bar areas are welcoming and up to date, the rooms/bathrooms are now very tired and are in need of refurbishment and modernising. The rooms/bathrooms are certainly 'no frills' and not worthy of a 4 star rating or the room rates charged. Having said this, the rooms/bathrooms are clean and the hotel is in a great location to discover Berlin... which is an amazing city. We won't be staying at Hotel Zoo again however have every intention in returning to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Location isn't everything”
Reviews.Author: perretto
Reviews.Content: From the outside and in the lobby area, the hotel looks great. But when I entered the room I was a bit dissapointed. I had booked a standard room. It looked old and gave you an uncomfortable feeling. So until the next night I decided to change to an executive room. When I asked for the price in the reception it was 20 euros more than on the website. I asked why, but she couldn't explain why and said she could give me 10 euros discount. I didn't want to argue anymore and said fine. The executive room was better and would be ok for that price I gave (89 euros), but not good compared to other hotels I have stayed in. Even though it was clean, it was old fashioned. The shower didn't work properly switching back and forth from hot to cold water, it was really enoying. Even though the location is great, next time I will try some other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean but worn-out and old rooms”
Reviews.Author: Virrvarr
Reviews.Content: With great location (just a few minutes walk from Zoological garten station) this hotel provides good value for money if booked with discount from one of the internet sights. We got a room on the 5th floor facing the garden so it was very quiet. The room was very big with a big bathroom. It was really clean but the interiour was dated and quite worn-out. The breakfeast buffe was great with good selection of food but it is not worth 17 euros. I would recommend this hotel but one should bare in mind that it is old and not a fancy 4-star that you would expect from the pictures on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but thet wasn't enough”
Reviews.Author: nutela
Reviews.Content: First of all the location is great and the entrance of the hotel/reception is very modern and when we arrived we were sure we made the right choice..But when we took the elevator and we were on the second floor we started to get dissapointed..Nothing reminded us of a four star hotel. The carpet of the corridors is really dirty and the rooms have very old furniture..The widows are very old and the rooms are very noisy because of the train station and the car traffic of the road. The breakfast is average and does not worth 15 euros!!! You can get great breakfast outside the hotel with 5-7 euros. The stuff is friendly but that's about it.. But Berlin was fantastic and the location is ideal so I would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly eccentric, mainly pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elsiedoubleyou
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were allocated a twin room which was not what we wanted as a couple on a romantic break. The twin room had a very odd big white desk unit-type thing running across the middle of the room dividing the two beds - rather like a student study room in university digs. The room was very small to boot.. On deciding it was not right for us, we had no trouble at reception asking for a double room and were given a much larger room with twin beds pushed together. The bathroom was newly re-fitted and very clean. The room was somewhat characterless and rather empty but was generally fine. The pillows were not old but virtually wafer thin with no spares left in the room (you get one pillow each) but apparently reception would provide extra pillows if you ask.... From these two things, we were starting to get the impression with this hotel that better standards are available - but you get inferior things offered first until you actively ask for better! There was a fully stocked minibar but sadly nothing to make a morning cuppa with. Breakfast was hugely expensive - we paid 34 Euros for two people and decided to go for Starbucks the next day instead. The buffet breakfast was tasty and had lots of choice though. Location extremely good for shopping but you'll need to get on the u-bahn or s-bahn for a feww stops to get to many of the main tourist attractions. Nice cosy lounge area in the hotel, lit with little tea lights in glasses and some comfy chairs too. It is however, a lounge - not a bar, and you need to press a button on the wall to get someone to fetch you a drink from the little menu as opposed to having a bar open which you can approach at will.. A relaxed and friendly hotel overall. The common areas are swisher than the quite plain rooms - which could easily be made cosier and more welcoming with the right design touches. Slightly ecccentric, mainly pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok, not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: D1P1
Reviews.Content: The location is really good - close to a main train station, close to lots of restaurants and coffee shops. The room was very disappointing, and not four stars. Everything was clean, the bed firm (but creaky), shower ok. But the deco was very dated (70s style with worn carpet), the blind ripped (no curtains), very poor lighting (don't think about doing your make up in the bathroom) and the room layout was very poor. Given the images on the website and price I was expecting a lot better. If you get a good deal, and are not going to spend much time in the room, then this hotel is ok. But I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Know what you're getting into...”
Reviews.Author: FreakySalamander
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 8-day stay at the Berlin Zoo and having thoroughly read through the previous reviews, i wasn't too surprised by the hotel and its rooms. Luckily we got a room facing the courtyard so we were shielded by the noise from the street although wecould clearly hear the trains in the background but it was alright, you could sleep through it. Of course there wasn't any AC but we did have a fan upon our arrival but it really didn't do that much. I understand there's no AC but i still could not understand how the hotel could be at least 10 degrees hotter than it was outside even when the outside temperature was relatively cool and windy. Like other reviews have pointed out, yes the carpets are old and stained but it didn't really bother me. We had a minibar in the room and we took out all the stuff out so we could store some water but it rarely kept anything cool. Despite the bathroom being "old", i liked it. Ok, there are old beige-ish tiles but it was really big compared to other european hotels i have stayed at before and i like the extra space. The towels were changed every day and the trash was also emptied out. The only thing that i hated were the beds and the non-existant pillows, it literally broke our backs every day. It really was pure torture!!! THe beds were hard and some were bulky while the pillows were for the most part flat as pancakes. Taht single experience is enough for me not to return there for more than a few days. The curtains are see-through so you do get light in early in the day and the sun straight into the room in the afternoon.We did not have breakfast at the hotel but there is a bakery shop just a few seconds from the hotel with great eats. About the service, they did their job ok and have not met one that was too surly. So all in all, our experience was alright despite the horrible heat in the end of our stay and the horrible beds we had to sleep on. Like i've said before, i had read the reviews for this hotel beforehand so i wasn't too surprised with little things like stained carpets and the no AC. If someone would be looking to stay in a hotel that was near everything for a few days, i would recommend this place but they should definitely be aware what they're getting into.

Reviews.Title: “A Curates egg.”
Reviews.Author: Tebeltebels
Reviews.Content: The reader will see that reviews for this establishment vary widely. This writer can only comment on our experience so with that in mind ... Judging by the usual criteria for hotels in Northern Europe by and large this hotel is NOT 4 star the facilities being rather limited. Despite what you might read in the blurbs there is no air-conditioning in the accepted sense of the term in the public areas. We found one portable air-conditioner in the first floor lounge and it was usually turned off despite outside temperatures of 22 deg C plus. There is definitely no air-con in rooms. Our son had a fan in his room but we had to wait until the second day for one to come available from a guest having checked out. On arrival at about 5 o'clock the temperature in our room was 89 deg F. Our rooms on the 5th floor, 527 & 528, were at the front of the hotel looking out onto Kurfurstendamm Str and our only option to avoid suffocation was to leave the door on to the balcony (a rather precarious perch to say the least) open all night. While this eased the heat a bit (down to 80 deg F by morning) the noise from outside was extreme, traffic, revellers etc., until 3 am and later - fortunately for me I had ear-plugs but my wife cannot wear them so had extremely disturbed sleep. As for the room itself: the carpet was heavily stained, and the room layout was unusual to say the least, there were two single beds arranged as right angles to each other with a lollypop shaped table affair between them; while the room was cleaned every day change of bed linen was an option which could be requested rather than a norm; there was a most unpleasant smell in the bathroom (which was itself quite nice); for English speakers the only chanel on the rather antiquated TV was CNN so pretty poor. Our deal was room only and we intended to pay for breakfast separately; on arrival we were offered a "trial" of two for one, which we accepted. The breakfast was buffet style catering for most tastes (e.g. scrambled egs, incinerated bacon, sausages, cereals, various yoghurts, fruit, cakes etc.) best described as average, but the price wasn't at 17 euro. The staff were pleasant enough but the tourist advice was frequently incomplete. The G-Lounge on the first floor is rather nice, however, references in descriptions of the hotel's facilities to hot and cold snacks and cocktails (and other drinks) being available is rather misleading; there is no bar in the hotel, rather the ladies at reception, from which the G-Lounge can be seen, keep an eye on whether guests are in the Lounge and pop up to take orders then disappear to some unseen location only to reappear later with ones order. I guess this is an example of multi-tasking (keeping overheads down). In summary: if you get a good deal on price, you don't go when the weather is hot, you don't want too many frills but a reasonably located base and are prepared to go out for breakfast then ok, otherwise look for somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: DutchTraveler9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is being promoted as "modern" on the website and so are the pictures of the rooms, but in my opinion these are false images. We stayed for 4 nights. We were allocated on the 5th floor (we booked two twin rooms) and were immediately unpleasantly surprised by the look of the hallways. The room was very small, old, dark, hot and smelled unpleasant. The furniture looked like it came directly from a retirement home and there were stains everywere in the carpet. The bathroom was also very outdated (brown tiles etc.) We went back to the reception and explained the situation to the girl at the Front Desk. She didn't act very surprised but gave us another room to check for ourselves (...). This time the room was located on the 6th floor and was exactly the same, but a little cleaner. Everything looked so worn out.. The breakfast is o.k. Nothing wrong with that. The staff could be a little bit more friendly, as one of the staff members was kind of rude when we arrived at the breakfast and were about to sit down at one of the tables. He told us to go to the other side of the room. Apparently he was already preparing the tables for next morning... One of the receptionists told us that she would look for a nice club for us to go to at night. After asking some questions about what kind of music we preferred she would look it up for us. We never heard from her again or saw here again during or stay. The staff is friendly but nothing more. When we ordered ice cubes (as suggested in the room directory) we had to pick them up ourselves, because there was nobody that could bring them up. The cleaning of the room was very simple. The beds were not changed once in 4 days (not very pleasant in a hot room without airconditioning or fans). Garbage was not picked up once. Belongings of previous guest under the bed (hair clips and such). The business centre of the hotel consists of one computer. 15 minutes for EUR 5. Ridiculous as WIFI in the lounge next to the business centre is free of charge! The location is perfect, but the next time I will book a true 4 star hotel and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to expectations.”
Reviews.Author: ElaineMPalmer
Reviews.Content: Although requesting a second floor room we ended up with a fourth floor room which was very small. It is not worthy of 4 stars and website does not reflect the standard of the hotel. Problems we had were: Small room although I notice other rooms much larger Fan in bathroom on all the time and noisy No Air conditioning and it was far too hot at night because ..... No black out curtains but frayed flimsy blinds which in order to pull down you had to shut the windows? Frayed carpets which looked dirty Towels old and needed replacing Location was great but hotel was sadly lacking. It was full so no chance to change anything. Next time I will book something in east Germany where hotels and area seemed much nicer and although the Hotel Zoo is in great location in west Germany, with all the shops I was not bothered about shopping as too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned - great location”
Reviews.Author: Lirio-Brasil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of Berlin, very well located for turism. Decoration is old fashioned dated to the 70´s. There is no amenities in the bathroom, and television and telephone also very old. Few English television, no pay per view channels. No air-conditioning When hotel is full, be prepared to a long waiting for a table during breakfast. No blackout curtain in the windows, so during summer be prepared to have day light in your room starting at 5 AM.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired, but great location”
Reviews.Author: cheekyd0g
Reviews.Content: Hotel Zoo is in a fantastic location, easy to get to via bus from Tegal airport, close to shops, etc, etc. The Hotel is not 4 stars. It is in need of renovation, the rooms are tired, and can be noisy (and no air conditioning which was an issue during our summer stay). The hotel is however clean and the staff are very helpful, and for the price the location is the best. I found the beds very worn and had trouble sleeping, so would probably spend more money next time for a newer hotel to get decent sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rooms and Stuff”
Reviews.Author: ReuvenM
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th visit to this hotel. I'm a journalist and travel a lot to Germany's Messe's, and Hotel Zoo offers a center point location, nice breakfast and decent rooms. You have WIFI (in the lounge area) and parking on location (need to drive around hotel block to reach the parking, which has a lot of space and back entrance to hotel). Better choose a room not on Kurfu front if you want dead-silence. ( I always request a room which is around the internal garden At this location most hotel are based on old buildings, and this one has history (look at the pictures inside the corridor!). This location will SAVE you a lot of time and money; all shops and restaurants a step away, action filled areas, tour buses, underground station... all just outside the hotel. After being in other hotels in Berlin, I've found this hotel to be a classic choice for tourist and business persons. Room was spacey, looks like it was renovated lately, a bathroom with 2 sinks, shiny and clean, though the bath tub was a bit higher than my liking. I wish they had a kettle in each room. Great stuff, good english, maps, help around. Amazing how the Assistant General Manager emailed me to get response on my visit and if I have any suggestions - this is a way to run hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: UK_Baldrick
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive after reading the reviews about this hotel, however there was no need to be, the reception staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was very big and bright, The location near the U and S Bahn and in the center of the best shopping in Berlin make this ideal for anyone wanting to explore this fascinating city, The Zoo hotel is also close to plenty of night life. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but found a great restaurant down the street opposite where breakfast was available from €2.90 to €6.00 for full english. The negatives on the hotel, the carpets are looking a bit tired and there is only a small TV in the rooms with CNN being the only english language channel available, but you don't go to Berlin to watch TV.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but refurbishment needed”
Reviews.Author: viewfields
Reviews.Content: The hotel Zoo really deserves a refurbishment, it has all the ingredients to be a great 3 or fantastic four star hotels. The location on one of Berlin's main shopping centres is great and proximity to transport connections fantastic. Hotel neighbours include the 5 star Swiss Hotel and Concorde where room rates are far more expensive than at Zoo. The staff are friendly and helpful. The room sizes are great although some do have windows to the train line and can be a little noisy. The hotel needs updated to reflect demands of 21st century travellers, what is there, is fine but a little expenditure on the tired finishes would really change the overall experience of a stay in Berlin. One good thing about the lack of modern ambience in the rooms is that you are forced to spend many hours exploring the wonderful sights, architecture and history of Berlin, which is the main purpose of a city break in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lgrogers1993
Reviews.Content: The hotel was is a great location. The staff was very nice and helpful and the breakfast was fantastic. The rooms could use some renovations, such as new carpet or flooring and modern furnishings. Everything was a bit dated looking but still, the sheets and blankets were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Carlittu
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, friendly staff, good rooms. I loved the lounge area, despite not having a dedicated bar the service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: metrochica
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Hotel Zoo and I have nothing bad to say about it. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly including the housekeeping staff. I called them directly and was offered a great rate including breakfast. It is ideally situated on the beautiful Kudamm steps away from excellent restaurants and shopping. Its perfect for adventuring as it is right on the bus and u-bahn subway line. In fact, you can take the 109 bus from the airport directly to the hotel. My room was large with plenty of storage, good lighting, and a clean bathroom with a tub and shower. Yes the room was bit dated, but that didn't bother me because everything was clean and comfortable. If you want an ultra modern hotel to sit in all day instead of spending it outside seeing the sights, then go elsewhere. I agree with other travelers that the breakfast buffet was wonderful. A great selection of hot and cold food and fresh fruit. While there is no real bar, you can order a drink from the front desk and they'll bring it to you in the nice lounge area. Its a great place to sit and meet other travelers. The hotel even played films and pop concert videos up against the lounge wall. I think the hotel receives a bad rap because of the S-bahn train line that runs near it. I was actually on that side of the hotel and I can honestly say it didn't bother me at all and I slept really well. But if you are a light sleeper or spend most of your day in the room then I can see how it may be a problem. Overall, I was tremendously happy with Hotel Zoo. I intend to stay there again if I I get a chance to return to fabulous Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Global-Ally
Reviews.Content: During a recent stay at the Hotel Zoo in Berlin, we had excellent experiences. Our room was ready early, which is rare but much appreciated after 24 hours of travel. The room, a junior suite, was spacious and had a wonderful view of Ku'domme, the major street. It provided nice views but little to no noise pollution. Breakfast, which was included in our rate, was excellent! The staff was wonderful and very responsive. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: susannah_c101
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location on the main shopping street and very near to the zoo and u-bahn, s-bahn station. The area was busy and felt safe at night. The hotel entrance was a lot nicer than the rooms but the one we had was large and although wasn't very modern and I wouldn't call it 4 star it was fine considering the price. Breakfast was good too, lots too choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay there”
Reviews.Author: flyingbanker
Reviews.Content: Was booked into this hotel based on the photos on the website - which are very misleading. The rooms are distintly 50s style and extremely worn. There were dirty patches all over the carpet and the train line which goes by the hotel will keep you awake all night.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed! Not what you expect for a 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: Sidies27
Reviews.Content: Booked this as a suprise weekend away for my partner - wanted it to be special, but it was far from it. The room we were allocated initially was pokey with marks on the carpet and a small bathroom with a shower cubicle. I had no choice about walking out to find an alternative hotel becuase we had paid up front. There wasn't even enough room for a tv stand, it had to be fixed on a bracket attached to the wall. I asked for a room with a bath and the only option was to upgrade - which costs a further £100 (120 euros). The breakfast was not included in this. If you want to buy breakfast upfront it costs 11 euros, but if you'd rather not make the decision until later or in the morning, you have to pay 16 euros each. we did eventually upgrade into a room which had limited day light and an artificial window on one side infront of a painted landscape. The day light effect was provided by a naked strip light! The carpet in this room too was dirty. There was a dead insect in the hallway which was there for the 3 days we were. The good thing was that the bathroom was in fact clean, but complimentary toiletries means there is a soap/shampoo/body wash all-in-one dispenser. There were no tea and coffee making facilities either. The 'business centre' had one computer which was engaged whenever we tried to use it. Yes, there are definately 4 stars at the entrance, but this means a very different thing in Germany perhaps? and it looks like they may have once been fit for it, but it is clearly time for a revamp.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Zoo, Berlin. Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen12
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Berlin where we stayed in this hotel for five nights. We found it to be an excellent hotel. The staff were business like and on the face of it a little aloof but when you spoke to them they were very helpful. The housekeeping was excellent, in particular one English person who was very friendly. He cleaned the room, folded clothes, aired the room and did things for us beyond what his normal job would have been. Breakfast was basic, but served in nice surroundings, the hotel was quiet and ideally situated. The room for three persons was large and airy. The bathroom small but well laid out with two wash basins, shower over half bath and toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than the other reviews led us to expect!”
Reviews.Author: Hello03
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Zoo as a 3* option as part of a KLM break (though when the final email arrived it appeared we'd been booked through Lastminute.com). We were very pleased with the hotel. It was far better than some of the previous reviews had suggested. The location was excellent - close to shops, cafes, restaurants, bakery, U bahn, bus stop direct to airport and sight seeing tour. There was also a cut price ticket office round the corner offering tickets for the current shows. The reception interior was very trendy with service efficient. In fact all staff were helpful and pleasant. Many of the other hotel guests were seen on their laptops throughout the hotel. Breakfast provided a good selection of hot and cold food, juices and tea/coffee. We had no problems in being seated promptly. Likewise the lounge area on the first floor was welcoming and calm - perfect for a night cap! The room itself contained twin beds, a large desk (great if you had to work on a laptop), wardrobe, mini bar & large bathroom with shower over the bath. We were situated to the rear of the property and although fairly close to the train line were not adversely affected by the noise. The window had twin glazing and electric blinds. The decor was plain but clean and towels were changed regularly. I would definitely stay here again either for work or a holiday and with friends, on my own or with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Good Location”
Reviews.Author: sp0rtygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in June 2008 for 2 nights. Overall the hotel was excellent value for the price paid E99.00 and this included an very good breakfast. It was easy to find on the Ku'damm, close to the train station and in a safe and central location. Staff were all friendly and answered any queries we had right away. I was a little nervous after reading the reviews but we had a huge room - with 2 comfy easy chairs, a large bathroom that was spotless and true there was no headboard on the bed but again this wasn't a big deal for us. The only negative was our room was on the main road side of the building so it was noisy from the traffic but this is expected in Europe and nothing earplugs cant fix. I would totally recommend staying here, we travelled Europe for 4 weeks and this hotel was good value and one of the better deals we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “the rooms very deplorable 2 bed one behind the other bathroom for midget”
Reviews.Author: cityHaifa
Reviews.Content: we arrive at 6 juny 2008 for 4 nights we order 2 double bed rooms - standard rooms. we receive rooms very deplorable the bed one behind the other and wall was between the bed. the bathroom so small maybe for midget. we ask every day at the reception to change the rooms but its was fully booking. no air conditioner at the hotel including dining room. its was 31 degree - very hot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amanda7647
Reviews.Content: Although there were minor problems with housekeeping, the excellent staff took care of them immediately. They were efficient, friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were very good, the room comfortable, and the hotel well located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, shame about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: ramfoozle
Reviews.Content: A good location on the Ku'dam, but possibly the least comfortable room I've ever stayed in! No easy chairs, no head rest on the bed (making it impossible to read), no coffee-making facilities, no toiletries beyond a dreadful machine dispensing tiny quantities of cheap soap, hard gurney-style mattresses and only one accessible power socket. We formed the suspicion, walking down the stairs, that the top couple of floors (ours was the fifth) were their duff rooms, kept as a sort of penal colony for people who bought packages rather than paid the rack rate. Certainly, the hallways looked a great deal more elegant on the lower floors. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Location Could Not Be Better”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaGeorgia_8
Reviews.Content: Great value in a great location. A five-minute walk or less to one of the main train stations, the U-Bahn subway, the Wilhelm Memorial Church, the KaDeWe department store, one of the city bus tour stops, great shopping, restaurants, etc. Rooms are somewhat dated but are large, clean and quiet. Great breakfast buffet and appealing lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel close to everything......”
Reviews.Author: KoldingTraveller
Reviews.Content: Arriving from Denmark to a friendly and excellent hotel. The staff was very smiling in the reception and in the restaurant. Also the cleaning staff was nice and smiling. We had a wonderful room for four nights directly to the street Kurfurstendamm. An overall excellent hotel, - we will recomment this hotel and we will be back in the future. Erik - Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: goldengirl60
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with 4 friends on a "Golden girls" Christmas Shopping trip to Berlin. We found the hotel to be very conveniently situated to the many shops and the lovely christmas markets near the cathedral. We had 2 twin rooms and a single on the third floor which though small were comfortable, clean and quiet. Never any noise on the corridor and even my room which faced the busy street was quiet at night. We noted that the corridor carpet was being replaced and hopefully the room carpet too would also be replaced as this was a bit shoddy. The bathroom was very well equipped with good mirrors and lighting- shower was over bath but I would comment that the high side on the bath made access to shower difficult! Maybe this is a German thing! Excellent choice of food at the buffet for breakfast.- staff very friendly and helpful at reception. I would stay there again if visiting the city- which I would add is beautiful at christmas time - the decorations very a joy to see both on the streets and in the shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Mayachagal
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great value for price paid. Good customer service. The only lacking thing is free wireless access in the rooms. Wireless is accessible only at the hotel lobby which is not very convenient. Heating control is not very flexible. Had to sleep with the window open as it became very hot at night. Overall, it was a good hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: lambros_21
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated in a street full of shops and within walking distance from KaDeWe. The underground is just 100 meters away and the light railway not more than 400m. A tourist information office is in an alley next to the hotel. The room was spacious, warm and clean. The noise level was next to zero although the next room was also occupied. The breakfast buffet was quite rich and of good quality. Having visited Berlin just before Christmas, we were pleasantly surprised on the next day after our arrival to run across a Christmas market nearby. Berlin was full of such markets and we had the chance to see it in full Christmas spirit, which was a very nice plus for our trip. For non german-speaking persons, you must get used to the idea that foreign languages do not appear to be the strong point of Germans. Yet, they shall give it a try anyhow.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine and dandy!”
Reviews.Author: TORN1
Reviews.Content: Berlin is an amazing city and I really enjoyed the Hotel Am Zoo! OK, they no longer use AM but it is still on the building itself. Location: Very centrally located. 100 metres from the U-bahn and maybe a 5 minute walk from Zoo Station which has multiple U and S Bahn services. Shopping at your door step although most shops are high end or very touristic in nature. Clean and well lite area however so this area is fine. A walk to Potsdammer Platz is about 35 minutes with a few routes to choose from. The Tiergarten is nearby as well. Amenities: Pretty simple although I wasn't there to go for a haircut or spa treatment so I didn't mind. No gym but take the stairs and walk this city if you need a workout. I never ate at the restuarant or used the bar, just not my thing. For 14 Euros for the breakfast I also thought it was a little pricey. For 2 - 3 Euros I got amazing baked goods and excellent coffee from local bakeries which are plentiful everywhere. Don't forget to try the Currywurst on the street. Very delicous for 1 - 2 Euros. Room: I was travelling alone and my room had two single beds. I needed to use the duvet from the second bed as typical German duvets are not very long. There was a writing desk with two chairs, inroom safe, ample closet space in the hallway and a stocked fridge. Got the munchies one night and it cost 10 Euros and I only had a coke, some peanuts and the chocolate covered almonds. A bit pricey but then again I would be shocked to find a hotel mini-bar that wasn't expensive. Heating is of the water pipe variety so did hear some cluncking around of the pipes one night when the temperature dipped below 0. As I booked through a mass hotel reservation site, I got a room on the second floor at the back of the hotel. Not a great view although with 12 foot ceilings there was lots of natural light, besides I didn't go there too look out my window anyway. There was a train track about 150 metres from the back of the hotel but really wasn't bothersome at all. I actually found the rooms to be rather soundproof as well,unless there was noone else in the rooms next to mine. The bathroom was large but akward with the toilet roll dispenser almost touching part of the toilet. Very little leg room because of that, as well there was a moveable towel rock on the other side of the toilet further limiting freedom of movement. Cleanliness: I had no problems with the maid service and found the whole hotel to be rather clean. A Japanese couple were at the desk one evening complaining that he had been bitten by a bedbug however and had a few appropriately sized bit marks on their body. I had no problems with this however. Overall well worth the under $100 CAN per night and would recommend this to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: journeyspider
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two night and found the hotel clean and comfortable with attentive service and a good breakfast buffet. WiFi in the lobby rather than in the rooms was the only downside for my purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Hote Zoo, Not For Animals Haha”
Reviews.Author: DiegoLopez
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for HustlaBall events 18th to 21st October 2007. Efficient, clean and friendly, The rooms are nice and big, I had a double although I went alone! Rooms are double glazed. The bar on the first floor is a friendly place to chat to others at the hotel, they also offer network access for your laptop there and have tables by the windows overlooking the main road outside. A nice glass lift takes you up the 4 floors. Breakfast is self service, coffee brought to your table. Perfect location, good price and recomended, I shall use this hotel again for next years HustlaBall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: KevinLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for our one night in Berlin, excellent location close to train stations with direct access from the airport. Arrived at 10:00am and went to the hotel to drop of our bag, hotel said they had a room ready if we wanted it! The hotel is clean and the room we had was large, it is an old building so don't expect a modern layout. We had breakfast as part of our deal, this was very good and kept us going from 10:30 am until 18:00 hours. Great hotel, great location, great breakfast, and a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Break”
Reviews.Author: HaynesNottingham_UK
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the hotel on a city break. The location is fantastic, the staff were always very helpful. The room was spacious and clean, only comment we could make is that the mattress was rather soft. Would recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DCoopUlster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and i have to say it ticks all the boxes. Rooms nice and clean and spacious. Location is on Ku'damm with all its shopping outlets, cafes and bars. Underground station located beside the hotel so getting around berlin is no problem. Also one of the open top bus tours start from beside the hotel which was great. Couldn't tell you about breakfast as i had a flight to catch at 8am so was up and away from hotel early, But all in all a very nice hotel that i would book if i was to return to berlin for a longer trip.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jenny83
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Zoo for a long weekend. We booked through a BA holiday deal and as a result the room we were allocated was probably not the best they could offer. The bedroom and bathroom were small and the corridors bizarrely lit with fluorescent pink lighting! Our room was on the first floor adjacent to the dining room, so during the breakfast period (from 7 - 11 on weekends) we were constantly disturbed by clattering plates and cutlery etc. The location of the hotel was good - right next to the Ku'damm metro station, but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Killer breakfast”
Reviews.Author: eztur
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel two years in a row. Both times it was a great experience. The rooms are large, with nice bathrooms and comfortable beds. The personnel is friendly and they serve an excellent breakfast. On my next visit to Berlin I will surely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandia1
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with this hotel. Completely different to the photos on the website. Old rooms with dirty walls,no airco, smelly carpet and the handle of the door was broken. This hotel is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “praise for the hotel zoo berlin”
Reviews.Author: bobmacNewtonMearns
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Zoo for a week in January,2007 and found it great value again. I say again and the reason I am a bit late with this as I cannot believe the reviews i am reading. Last June my wife and I stayed at the Zoo and found it spot on. We have been travelling through Germany on holiday for over 20 years and would recommend it to anyone. Hotel smart and staff outstanding. Location say no more and value get a life. We will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kirstiiii
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very easy to find with several trains running direct from the airports. The hotel reception is nice and modern looking and the rooms are a good size, the only problem was that our room didn't have air conditioning which may be a problem for travellers in the summer months. Staff are friendly and were always willing to help whenever we needed it. The great thing about the location of this hotel is that its right next to the shopping district (Kurfuerstendamm) and all the transport you need to get around this huge city are right on your doorstep. There's something for everyone at breakfast, if you can get breakfast included in the price it's very good value for money. Finding the hotel; * Getting to the hotel from Schonefiled Airport is easy. The train Station is easy to reach ( Look out for S-bahn signs) once you get there buy a ticket from the ticket machines (validate ticket before you get on the train) get the train to the Zoologischer Garten station, the hotel is a 5 minute walk away from this station. Tips; * Just around the corner to the left of the hotel is a tourist information. If you're going to be travelling around the whole city we'd reccommend that you buy a transport ticket that can be used on buses, trains or on the U-bahn, at around 17euros for 2 days this is great value for money (remember and validate your ticket) *Plenty of restaurants around, the HardRock cafe is a two minute walk down the street right in front of the hotel (ask the hotel staff for directions if unsure) and there's plenty of other restaurants to choose from. *If you're looking for a food store or supermarket the nearest one is about a 5 minute walk away from the hotel (Kaiser's). *If you're looking to visit the olympic stadium make sure there's not a football game on first as you'll not get to do the tour. *To see the best stretch of the Berlin wall (about 1.5km) get the train to the Ostbahnhof station and you're right there. Overall we had a great stay and thought the hotel was really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SaintLeTiss
Reviews.Content: Overall a great stay. Brilliant location for a great price, very clean rooms. So close to 3 subways where you could explore the whole city, we even had the marathon running past our hotel. The only bad thing i'd say is that the pillows were horrendous! The overall decor in the hallways etc could do with updating but not essential. Loved it and would stay again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location - max 3* interiors”
Reviews.Author: Laimdota
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a fantastic location for visitors who want great access to Kurfuerstendamm shopping (from couture boutiques to KaDeWe), theatres, restaurants and bars in the Charlottenburg area AND subway or buses on your doorstep. The hotel also offers "quiet" rooms to the courtyard which was a great plus when located on an otherwise busy boulevard. The room - as the hotel - is clean and well-maintained on a daily basis. However, it has not been touched, it seems, since the 1960's on any upgrades: beds, pillows, bedspreads, lighting, TV, internet - you name it. If retro-chic in its original state is what you are looking for, this is your hotel. Obviously there is a reason the hotel does not post room photos on its own website but leaves the impression of a bright, modern environment behind! Certainly not the place for a comfy shopping plus romance trip - the room is too sterile (though large) for that. Breakfast was fine, service was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Travelguy007
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Am Zoo for 2 nights at end of Jan '07. First impressions were good, location right at heart of the city, close to bars, restaurants and transport links. Unfortunately, the good first impressions were gone very quickly! We had ordered a double room, but were given a room with 2 single beds which couldn't be changed as hotel was full. Staff were completely unhelpful and treated our request for a room change in line with our booking with a shurg of the shoulders! Room we had was cold and very noisy due to closeness of railway. Hotel overall has seen better days and is in need of refurbishment. Breakfast was good and served til 11am at weekends. Overall, I would see this as a fairly good 3star hotel but quite far short of the four star we had been expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for AM Zoo”
Reviews.Author: Wombat_Sydney
Reviews.Content: Hotel AM ZOO is conveniently located on the famous Kurfürstendamm, just a short walk from Bahnhof Zoo station, the U-Bahn and bus station. My main gripe with this hotel was that I booked a double bed, but was only supplied with a single. When I discovered this too late to fix it, they at least threw in the buffet breakfast gratis. Otherwise, room was good, and buffet breakfast was excellent with good variety and differnt choices each day. No free internet point to check emails.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a city break (and panda spotting!)”
Reviews.Author: Chris043
Reviews.Content: My Girlfieind and I stayed at the Hotel Zoo for 3 nights in Mid December and found it exceeded our expectations. Our room was large and spacious, and had a particularly big bed, although seconding previous reviews the television is a little dated, and the only english channel is CNN! The room was immaculately clean and maid service was daily, we asked for 2 extra pillows on arrival and came back to find them shortly after, with a complimentary basket of fruit and biscuits which was very nice. Staff were always friendly and spoke good english. Location is superb, probably the best feature of the hotel, right on the Ku'damm, the bus from the airport (X109) stops right outside, and costs just 2.40 euros from Tegel Airport. Top tips *Breakfast can be found cheaper than the hotel at a lovely restaurant above the Gary Webber shop just a few doors up, and for half the price. *The Thai restaurant on the road behind the hotel 'The Elephant' is some of the best food i have ever had, and is very reasonable indeed. *KaDeWe is a must, and makes even harrods food court look small, great for a few glasses of champagne and some sushi! *The Zoo is a MUST, and not be missed at any time of year. Christmas markets give a very festive atmosphere and some great shopping opportunities.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrs.mops
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night break at the Hotel Zoo in Berlin and was really impressed with the hotel. Fantastic location for discovering Berlin - situated right in the centre of Berlin on the main shopping street The Kurfurstendamm - a very nice part of town too it was! Upon entering the hotel you couldn't but notice how clean and inviting it was, decorated beautifully for Christmas and candles lighting throughout the hotel reception and G Lounge. Staff were friendly. Breakfast was super and the rooms were a good size, really clean and comfortable. They could do with a little updating but they were very well maintained and cosy. We got a super rate of 87euro per room per night incl. breakfast when we booked directly through the hotel website. Only thing to comment on was that some of the websites selling rooms at this hotel state it has a 24 hour bar but it doesn't and we were a little disappointed when we returned to the hotel at 1am for a nightcap only to discover that the bar closes at midnight - however the mini bar in the room was well stocked and was very reasonable so we could get over this! All in all, highly recommend hotel Zoo and will definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Try some place else, poor service”
Reviews.Author: JohnH60
Reviews.Content: Addmittedly i stayed in a less expensive room in this hotel, so i could overlook somethings about the room, like the lack of cleanliness, really old crappy tv and the 1970's bathroom fictures in deep dark brown, what i found totally intolerable was the service. The leaning staff are either incompetent or poorly managed, the room was not cleaned properly, the carpet looked like a bunch of frats boys had partied there the night before and believe it or not, we had to call down to the front desk for toilet paper - apparently if we wanted a full soap container for the shower or more than 1 roll of toilet paper we had to ask someone. also the room was incredibly hot as it faced south, had poor ventilation and no air conditioning (although i noticed some rooms beside did have air). Fortunately i spent most of my time seeing the sites of berlin so the room didn't matter that much, but i still expect a basic level of service. If i go back to Berlin I will be looking for a hotel that tries harder to earn my business.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter75
Reviews.Content: I have just returned froma trip to Berlin, where I stayed at the Hotel Zoo. It is in a fantastic location, close to the s-bahn station and in a shopping area, where there are plenty of places to eat. The room was large and very spacious, as we were on the 6th floor we even had a small balcony. There was plenty of wardrobe space and a large bathroom, which had a shower over the bath. The only draw back was the cost of breakfast in the hotel (14 Euro), we found a lovely little cafe in the street opposite the hotel which did a fantsatic breakfast for just 1 Euro! So it's worth looking outside the hotel if your rate doesn't include breakfast. Overall I was very impressed with Hotel Zoo, I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: lochnagar
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel in early August and had two twin rooms on the 4th floor (both facing into the internal courtyard). The room layout was unusual in that the twin beds were set at right angles to each other in one room and "in-line" in the other. The rooms were quite clean but warm even with the windows wide open at night. The small fan provided didn't really help much. No noise from the street however. The location of the hotel is excellent for U-Bahn and S-Bahn connections - there's a U-Bahn station within 50 metres of the hotel and Zoological Garden station is only 5 minutes or so away. There are plenty of restaurants within easy walking and a lively bar practically across the road where live music is played most nights. We found the hotel staff to be efficient but not particularly friendly but the biggest problem was that on one morning, the buffet breakfast was a bit chaotic. The choice of food was fine but there weren't enough staff attending to replenish the food choices as they ran out and there didn't seem to be enough tables for everyone. In addition, the staff that morning did not clear away used dishes which meant the dining tables became cluttered. I would recommend visitors to Berlin to stay in the Ku'Damm but not necessarily at this hotel

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Zoo Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Kurfurstendamm 25 | Charlottenburg, 10719 Berlin, Germany
